name: cargo
description: Rust's build tool and package manager

hints.default: While cargo operations run, consider reviewing Cargo.toml dependencies, planning tests, or analyzing code structure for optimization opportunities.
hints.build: Building in progress - review compilation output for warnings, plan deployment steps, or work on documentation.
hints.test: Tests running - analyze test patterns, consider additional test cases, or review code coverage strategies.
hints.doc: Documentation building - consider reviewing doc comments, planning API improvements, or working on examples.
hints.check: Type checking in progress - plan refactoring opportunities or review code patterns while waiting.

subcommand.name: build
subcommand.description:
Compile the current package.

**IMPORTANT:** This tool operates asynchronously.
1. **Immediate Response:** Returns operation_id and status 'started'. NOT success.
2. **Final Result:** Result pushed automatically via MCP notification when complete.

**Your Instructions:**
- **DO NOT** wait for the final result.
- **DO** continue with other tasks that don't depend on this operation.
- You **MUST** process the future result notification to know if operation succeeded.

options.name: future-incompat-report
options.description: Outputs a future incompatibility report at the end of the build

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.name: color
options.description: Coloring [possible values: auto, always, never]

options.name: config
options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.name: unstable
options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo (use 'cargo -Z help' for details)

options.name: package
options.description: Package to build (see `cargo help pkgid`)

options.name: workspace
options.description: Build all packages in the workspace

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude packages from the build (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: all
options.description: Alias for --workspace (deprecated)

options.name: lib
options.description: Build only this package's library

options.name: bins
options.description: Build all binaries

options.name: bin
options.description: Build only the specified binary

options.name: examples
options.description: Build all examples

options.name: example
options.description: Build only the specified example

options.name: tests
options.description: Build all targets that have `test = true` set

options.name: test
options.description: Build only the specified test target

options.name: benches
options.description: Build all targets that have `bench = true` set

options.name: bench
options.description: Build only the specified bench target

options.name: all-targets
options.description: Build all targets

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: all-features
options.description: Activate all available features

options.name: no-default-features
options.description: Do not activate the `default` feature

options.name: release
options.description: Build artifacts in release mode, with optimizations

options.name: profile
options.description: Build artifacts with the specified profile

options.name: jobs
options.description: Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs (-j, --jobs <N>)

options.name: keep-going
options.description: Do not abort the build as soon as there is an error

options.name: target
options.description: Build for the target triple (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: target-dir
options.description: Directory for all generated artifacts

options.name: artifact-dir
options.description: Copy final artifacts to this directory (unstable)

options.name: build-plan
options.description: Output the build plan in JSON (unstable)

options.name: unit-graph
options.description: Output build graph in JSON (unstable)

options.name: timings
options.description: Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json

options.name: manifest-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.toml

options.name: lockfile-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.lock (unstable)

options.name: ignore-rust-version
options.description: Ignore `rust-version` specification in packages

options.name: locked
options.description: Assert that `Cargo.lock` will remain unchanged

options.name: offline
options.description: Run without accessing the network

options.name: frozen
options.description: Equivalent to specifying both --locked and --offline

subcommand.name: test
subcommand.description:
Run the test suite.

**IMPORTANT:** This tool operates asynchronously.
1. **Immediate Response:** Returns operation_id and status 'started'. NOT success.
2. **Final Result:** Result pushed automatically via MCP notification when complete.

**Your Instructions:**
- **DO NOT** wait for the final result.
- **DO** continue with other tasks that don't depend on this operation.
- You **MUST** process the future result notification to know if operation succeeded.

options.name: testname
options.description: If specified, only run tests containing this string in their names (positional argument)

options.name: args
options.description: Arguments for the test binary (use after '--')

options.name: no-run
options.description: Compile, but don't run tests

options.name: no-fail-fast
options.description: Run all tests regardless of failure

options.name: future-incompat-report
options.description: Outputs a future incompatibility report at the end of the build

options.name: message-format
options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]

options.name: quiet
options.description: Display one character per test instead of one line

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: color
options.description: Coloring [possible values: auto, always, never]

options.name: config
options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.name: unstable
options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo, see 'cargo -Z help' for details

options.name: package
options.description: Package to run tests for (see `cargo help pkgid`)

options.name: workspace
options.description: Test all packages in the workspace

options.name: exclude
options.description: Exclude packages from the test (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: all
options.description: Alias for --workspace (deprecated)

options.name: lib
options.description: Test only this package's library

options.name: bins
options.description: Test all binaries

options.name: bin
options.description: Test only the specified binary

options.name: examples
options.description: Test all examples

options.name: example
options.description: Test only the specified example

options.name: tests
options.description: Test all targets that have `test = true` set

options.name: test
options.description: Test only the specified test target

options.name: benches
options.description: Test all targets that have `bench = true` set

options.name: bench
options.description: Test only the specified bench target

options.name: all-targets
options.description: Test all targets (does not include doctests)

options.name: doc
options.description: Test only this library's documentation

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: all-features
options.description: Activate all available features

options.name: no-default-features
options.description: Do not activate the `default` feature

options.name: jobs
options.description: Number of parallel jobs, defaults to # of CPUs (-j, --jobs <N>)

options.name: release
options.description: Build artifacts in release mode, with optimizations

options.name: profile
options.description: Build artifacts with the specified profile

options.name: target
options.description: Build for the target triple (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: target-dir
options.description: Directory for all generated artifacts

options.name: unit-graph
options.description: Output build graph in JSON (unstable)

options.name: timings
options.description: Timing output formats (unstable) (comma separated): html, json

options.name: manifest-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.toml

options.name: lockfile-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.lock (unstable)

options.name: ignore-rust-version
options.description: Ignore `rust-version` specification in packages

options.description: Assert that `Cargo.lock` will remain unchanged

subcommand.name: check

Check code without building.

**IMPORTANT:** This tool operates asynchronously.
1. **Immediate Response:** Returns operation_id and status 'started'. NOT success.
2. **Final Result:** Result pushed automatically via MCP notification when complete.

**Your Instructions:**
- **DO NOT** wait for the final result.
- **DO** continue with other tasks that don't depend on this operation.
- You **MUST** process the future result notification to know if operation succeeded.

options.name: release
options.description: Check with release profile

options.name: workspace
options.description: Check all packages in workspace

options.name: fix

subcommand.name: run
subcommand.description: Run the project

options.name: release
options.description: Run with optimizations

options.name: bin
options.description: Name of the binary to run

subcommand.name: doc
subcommand.description: Generate documentation

options.name: no-deps
options.description: Don't build documentation for dependencies

options.name: open
options.description: Open documentation in browser

subcommand.name: clean
subcommand.description: Remove build artifacts

subcommand.name: add
subcommand.description: Add a dependency to Cargo.toml (requires cargo-edit)

options.name: package
options.description: Package name (and optional version) to add, e.g. serde@1.0

subcommand.name: remove
subcommand.description: Remove a dependency from Cargo.toml (requires cargo-edit)

options.name: package
options.description: Package name to remove

subcommand.name: update
subcommand.description: Update dependencies in Cargo.lock to latest compatible versions

options.name: package
options.description: Optional specific package to update

subcommand.name: fetch
subcommand.description: Download dependencies without building

subcommand.name: install
subcommand.description: Install a Rust binary via cargo

options.name: package
options.description: Package/binary to install

subcommand.name: search
subcommand.description: Search for packages on crates.io

options.name: query
options.description: Search query

subcommand.name: tree
subcommand.description: Display dependency tree - returns immediately.

subcommand.name: version
subcommand.description: Show cargo version information - returns immediately.

subcommand.name: metadata
subcommand.description: Output the resolved dependencies and package metadata as JSON - returns immediately.

options.name: filter-platform
options.description: Only include resolve dependencies matching the given target-triple

options.name: no-deps
options.description: Output information only about the workspace members and don't fetch dependencies

options.name: format-version
options.description: Format version [possible values: 1]

options.name: verbose
options.description: Use verbose output (-vv very verbose/build.rs output)

options.name: quiet
options.description: Do not print cargo log messages

options.name: color
options.description: Coloring [possible values: auto, always, never]

options.name: config
options.description: Override a configuration value (KEY=VALUE or PATH)

options.name: unstable
options.description: Unstable (nightly-only) flags to Cargo (use 'cargo -Z help' for details)

options.name: features
options.description: Space or comma separated list of features to activate

options.name: all-features
options.description: Activate all available features

options.name: no-default-features
options.description: Do not activate the `default` feature

options.name: manifest-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.toml

options.name: lockfile-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.lock (unstable)

options.name: locked
options.description: Assert that Cargo.lock will remain unchanged

options.name: offline
options.description: Run without accessing the network

options.name: frozen
options.description: Equivalent to specifying both --locked and --offline

subcommand.name: nextest
subcommand.description: Run tests with cargo-nextest (if installed)

options.name: verbose
options.description: Verbose output [env: NEXTEST_VERBOSE=]

options.name: color
options.description: Produce color output: auto, always, never [env: CARGO_TERM_COLOR=] [default: auto]

options.name: manifest-path
options.description: Path to Cargo.toml

options.name: config-file
options.description: Config file [default: workspace-root/.config/nextest.toml]

options.name: tool-config-file
options.description: Tool-specific config files in the format 'tool:abs_path'. May be specified multiple times; later files are lower priority.

options.name: override-version-check
options.description: Override checks for the minimum version defined in nextest's config

options.name: profile
options.description: The nextest profile to use [env: NEXTEST_PROFILE=]

options.name: workspace
options.description: Run tests for all packages in workspace

subcommand.name: audit
subcommand.description: Run security vulnerability scanning (if cargo-audit installed). Commands: bin (scan compiled binaries), help (print audit help).

options.name: color
options.description: color configuration (default: auto) [possible values: always, auto, never]

options.name: db
options.description: advisory database git repo path (default: ~/.cargo/advisory-db)

options.name: deny
options.description: exit with an error on: warnings (any), unmaintained, unsound, yanked

options.name: file
options.description: Cargo lockfile to inspect (or '-' for STDIN, default: Cargo.lock)

options.name: ignore
options.description: Advisory id(s) to ignore (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: ignore-source
options.description: Ignore sources of packages in Cargo.toml, matching advisories regardless of source

options.name: no-fetch
options.description: Do not perform a git fetch on the advisory DB

options.name: stale
options.description: Allow stale advisory database

options.name: target-arch
options.description: Filter vulnerabilities by CPU architecture (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: target-os
options.description: Filter vulnerabilities by OS (can be specified multiple times)

options.name: url
options.description: URL for advisory database git repo

options.name: quiet
options.description: Avoid printing unnecessary information

options.name: json
options.description: Output report in JSON format

subcommand.name: upgrade
subcommand.description: Upgrade dependency versions in Cargo.toml (requires cargo-edit)

options.name: yes
options.description: Automatically apply upgrades

subcommand.name: bump_version
subcommand.description: Bump package version (requires cargo-edit or custom script)

options.name: bump_type
options.description: patch, minor, or major

options.name: dry_run
options.description: Show changes without modifying files

subcommand.name: bench

**IMPORTANT:** This tool operates asynchronously.
1. **Immediate Response:** Returns operation_id and status 'started'. NOT success.

options.name: no-fail-fast
options.description: Run all benchmarks regardless of failure

options.description: Error format [possible values: human, short, json, json-diagnostic-short, json-diagnostic-rendered-ansi, json-render-diagnostics]
